results.title: Into the arms of strangers: stories of the Kindertransport
results.creator_credit: Sabine Films, United States Holocaust Memorial Museum, Deborah Oppenheimer and Mark Jonathan Harris
results.brief_description: Between December of 1938 and August of 1939, some 10,000 Jewish and other children were transported from Germany and the German held countries of Austria and Czechoslovakia to Great Britain under the ‘Kindertransport’ initiative. Most were adopted by British families with the majority never seeing their birth parents again. In this documentary, archival footage is interspersed with the recollections of twelve child survivors as well as those of rescuers, parents and foster parents. Through moving, candid, detail-filled commentaries spoken directly to the camera, they each provide personal insights into different aspects of the evacuation. The emotional confusion and pain that is the legacy of the survivors’ extraordinary childhood experiences is poignantly expressed through their conflicting feelings of abandonment, loss, thankfulness, guilt and resentment. (Awards: Winner of ‘Best Documentary Feature’, Academy Awards, 2000)

results.title: Intimacy
results.creator_credit: Arte France, Azor Films, Canal+, Jacques Hinstin, Patrick Cassavetti and Patrice Chereau
results.brief_description: The opening moments of “Intimacy” set the scene perfectly for this erotic drama, that is also an examination of an quite ordinary marriage: two people, in a grotty, shambolic London house, engage in urgent and silent sex, communicating nothing other than their instinct for lust and pleasure. As the narrative unfurls we discover segments of both protagonists’ lives, and possible explanations about the motivations that inspire their urges. For Claire, it is perhaps an escape from the ordinariness of her life as a wife, mother and amateur actress; for Jay, it is perhaps an emotional stopgap for the absence of his wife and son. Despite the agreed anonymity of their union, Jay starts to obsess over Claire’s life outside of their ribald encounters and stalks her, discovering her family commitments and even anonymously befriending her husband, Andy. Jay toys with Andy (Timothy Spall) spinning a tale of the married woman and mother of one, that he meets weekly for sex, encouraging Andy to ponder what drives a woman to such deeds. Within this intriguing set-up, lie concealed details about characters’ motivation, leaving the viewer with only a very superficial view of what spurs the protagonists’ conduct. Hence, despite attempts at realism via the aesthetic de-glamorisation of the characters, the narrative is simply aimless eroticism that will be remembered not for its art but for the scandal garnered due to the depiction of actual fellatio and masturbation. Based on a story by Hanif Kureishi and the first English-language film for French director Patrice Chereau. Also stars Mark Rylance (as Jay) and Marianne Faithfull.

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: David O Selznick Productions, David O. Selznick and Gregory Ratoff
results.brief_description: A tragic but moving love story starring Ingrid Bergmann and Leslie Howard. The great concert violonist Holger Brandt is attracted to Anita Hoffman although he is happily married. He soon finds his love for Anita overwhelming and leaves his wife to tour Europe with her. But he cannot leave his past and his family ties behind and Anita sensing his dilemma, leaves him although it breaks her heart. Eventually Holgar and his wife are reunited as they share a personal tragedy. Sentimental, ‘Intermezzo’ is a great romantic classic.

results.title: Instinct
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Barbara Boyle, Michael Taylor, Richard Lerner, Brian Doubleday, Christina Steinberg and Jon Turteltaub
results.brief_description: This psychological thriller is about an anthropologist, Ethan Powell, who leaves human society to live among gorillas. Fully ensconced in this animal world, Powell is extradited back to the United States after murdering two gorilla poachers. Once there, it falls to an ambitious psychiatrist to discover the non-communicative Powell’s secrets. With in-form performances by Anthony Hopkins and Cuba Gooding Jr, this film attempts with profundity to address human nature, harmony with the natural world, and what motivates passions bordering on insanity. Cast also includes Donald Sutherland.

results.title: Insomnia (2002)
results.creator_credit: Alcon Entertainment, Witt Thomas Section Eight Productions, Paul Junger Witt, Edward McDonnell, Broderick Johnson, Andrew A Kosove and Christopher Nolan
results.brief_description: A police detective (Al Pacino) wanted for questioning by Internal Affairs flies to Alaska to assist in a murder enquiry. In pursuit of the suspect in deep fog, his partner is shot and the accident leads the murderer (Robin Williams) to blackmail the detective. Due to the Midnight Sun and the stress of the situation he finds himself in, the detective suffers from insomnia which impacts on his judgement in dealing with his partner’s death. An earnest young police detective (Hilary Swank) is thorough in her investigative techniques and discovers the truth. Based on the film “Insomnia” directed by Erik Skjoldbjaerg, this all-star version is just as compelling. Cast includes Martin Donovan, Paul Dooley.

results.title: Insignificance
results.creator_credit: Recorded Picture Company, Zenith, Jeremy Thomas and Nicolas Roeg
results.brief_description: In New York in 1953 four 20th century icons are dropped into a melting pot of the sexual and the cerebral. An actress demonstrates the theory of relativity. A professor shows off his legs. A senator’s sweaty impotence is shoved up against a ballplayer’s psychotic tenderness. But locked inside them all are memories, childhood and compromise, bubblegum heroes and profound fears. A screen adaptation of Terry Johnson’s play this thought-provoking movie stars Theresa Russell, Tony Curtis, Gary Busey and Michael Emil.

results.title: Inherit the wind
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and Stanley Kramer
results.brief_description: Inspired by the famous “Monkey Trial” of 1925, when a school teacher in Tennessee stood accused of teaching Darwin’s theory of evolution, this outstanding courtroom drama embodies the century old debate between Evolutionists and Creationists. The tightly woven script is highlighted by the timeless performances of Spencer Tracy and Fredric March as the defense and prosecution attorneys, Gene Kelly as the cynical, progressive reporter and Dick York as the young teacher.

results.title: Indochine [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Paradis Films, La Generale D'Images, Bac Films (France), Orly Films, Cine 5, Eric Heumann, Jean Labadie and Regis Wargnier
results.brief_description: Set in 1930 in French Indochina, on the cusp of revolution, the 1993 Academy Award Winning Best Foreign Film, “Indochine” is the epic story of two women; a French mother and her adopted Indochinese daughter. Their relationship survives social and cultural obstacles, but is ultimately stretched to extremes by their passionate love for the same man. The awesome beauty of Vietnam provides a perfect backdrop for this splendid film. Catherine Deneuve gives a “tour de force” performance. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Indiscretion of an American wife = Stazione Termini
results.creator_credit: Selznick Releasing Organization and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: Mary is an American housewife trying to make the heart-rending decision of whether to go back to her husband and family or remain in Rome with her lover, Giovanni, a university professor she has met during her stay. Most of the story takes place in the Rome railway station, where Mary and Giovanni meet for one last desperate rendezvous. Their search for a secluded spot where they can be together, threatens to expose their illicit affair. However, an understanding railroad commissioner releases the two and Mary is permitted to return to her husband with an unsullied reputation. Cast includes: Jennifer Jones, Montgomery Clift, Gino Cervi and Richard Beymer.

results.title: Indiscreet
results.brief_description: A NATO officer meets a beautiful actress and falls in love with her, but protects himself by saying he is married. The script of this film was written by Norman Krasna, based on his play “Kind Sir”. It stars Cary Grant and Ingrid Bergman.
